Key Arguments: The legislation restricts freedom of expression and could lead to government and corporate tyranny.
Censorship of social media will impede the exchange of ideas necessary for scientific and societal progress.
The proposed legislation lacks clear definitions of misinformation and disinformation, leading to potential overreach.
There is a history of government and regulatory bodies being incorrect or influenced by industry, which undermines trust.
The COVID-19 pandemic response has shown that reliance on 'experts' can be problematic due to biases and conflicts of interest.
Main Themes: Trust in Government and Regulatory Bodies
Notable Quotes: Censorship of social media will have the same effect.
The proposed legislation will make government and corporations unaccountable leading to tyranny and injustice for the average member of the community.
Centralisation of 'knowledge' and decision making, destroys the mechanisms of error correction.
